text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Military administrators appointed for six new states created this week.
- Niger delta where much of Nigeria's crude oil is produced records 500 oil spillages annually, a World Bank report says.
- Foreign exchange demand at weekly auction rises slightly to $34.78 million from $34.35 million last week.
- Two political activists freed from detention.
- First Securities Discount House Limited says annual profit to June this year lept to 137.707 million naira from 104.562 million to June last year despite harsh operating climate.
- Revenue from life insurance premiums slumps by 424 million naira or 40 percent this year from last year, says industry committee.
- National Electric Power Authority retires 1,000 workers as part of rationalisation of government agencies.

- Confusion at home over announcement in Washington by Nigerian Finance Minister Anthony Ani that interest rates have been uncapped because no official directive to that effect has been issued by central bank.
- Federal government to spend 65.6 billion naira on gas projects within next two years.
